In general, parcel level data can be considered more accurate than lines digitized from RF 24,000 scale topographic maps (which are very approximate).  However, town boundaries are notoriously difficult to accurately locate.  Where two adjoining towns have parcel-level data, the common boundary has been known to disagree between towns by hundreds of meters.  12/16/93. </complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar> The accuracy of each feature depends on its source data. The first three digits (ccc) are a county FIPS code (001 to 027 by odd numbers, alphabetical by county).  The last three digits (ttt) are a Census Place code (in multiples of 005, alphabetical within county).  See the Geographic Area Codes standard in the VGIS handbook for a description and a list of geographic area codes used in Vermont.  Also, data product \\GEOCODES is a database of geographic codes used to generate the guideline. </attrvae> </attrvai> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>TOWNNAME</attrlabl> <attrdef>Name of town in upper case
